Deficiency Narrative: During a monitoring inspection, the operation was unaware of an evaluation that addressed the unauthorized absences.
Correction Narrative: In an email received from the administrator on 08/26/25 the following corrective action plan was attached with the plan for findings: Girls Haven has completed the unauthorized absence evaluation and will continue to update every 6 months. A copy of the evaluation was received in a separate email.

Deficiency Narrative: The fire inspection conducted identified areas of concern that needed correction.
Correction Narrative: A corrective action plan was received via email from the administrator on 08/21/25. The plan identified the following: GH will ensure all areas of concern are corrected in a timely manner and future inspections will be done separately from the Ehrhart School to ensure proper inspection and report scores. A copy of the completed and corrected fire inspection was received from the operation by email on 09/02/25 from the administrator.

Deficiency Narrative:
RCM completed an HM visit at Girls Haven on 05/14/2025 RCM observed a youths hair to remain in dry, flaky, brittle, and unmanaged.  Her hair was observed to be dry, flaky brittle and unmanaged during the visit on 04/30/2025, at which the administrator stated she would ensure the youth receive proper hair treatment.  During the visit on 04/30/2025, RCM spoke with the youth regarding her hair treatment. The youth stated she previously had braids but took them down after a few weeks because her scalp was itching and flaking.  She was informed by staff she could not get braids again because she took them down to soon.  
On 05/14/2025 RCM spoke with the same youth regarding her hair care. Youth reported she blow dries her hair in the morning. When asked why she blow dries her hair when its already dry, youth stated she wants it to be strait.  RCM advised she needs to moisturize her hair daily to prevent it from breaking. Youth stated her sister (also placed at the facility) was going to braid her hair. Its important to note other youth (of African American decent) hair was also observed to be dry and in need of treatment.
Correction Narrative: On 06/04/25, an email received from the administrator identified the following plan of correction: The youth in question along with 5 other youth have had hair appointments since 5/14/25 and had their hair cut and/or braided. Girls' Haven will continue to hand out appropriate hair products and will document when each girl is provided with items. Administrator will schedule training on hair care for the residents.

Deficiency Narrative: During an inspection, an employee no longer with the operation remained active on the people list.
During an inspection, the service plan for a child was not signed by the case manager.
During an inspection, a personnel record did not contain evidence of two reference checks completed.
Correction Narrative:
On 05/21/25 an email with the following plan of correction was received from the administrator: Girls Haven will ensure all new hire files have documented record of references being contacted to verify the applicant is suitable to work around children. Residential Supervisor and Executive Director will continue to audit and maintain all personnel files for this information.
On 05/19/25, an email was sent to the administrator with a reminder to send the plan of correction that was due on 05/14/25.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's unauthorized absence was not reported to licensing within 6 hours.
Correction Narrative: On 5/12/25 corrections were received via email. The agency's Administrator will either make the report or delegate the report to an on-shift supervisor after reviewing the reporting time expectations in standards.

Deficiency Narrative:
During a review conducted on March 14, 2025, it was determined that:

(1) your operations administrator failed to ensure compliance with the current HM Plan; and

(2) 12 months had elapsed since the effective date of the plan.

As you know, the heightened monitoring plan for your operation included a specific planned end date at the
12-month mark by which your operation was expected to meet all heightened monitoring criteria necessary to
move out of active heightened monitoring to a phase of post plan monitoring. As a direct result of the 
administrators failure to ensure timely compliance with heightened monitoring plan, your operation is now unable 
to successfully move to post-plan monitoring.

Furthermore, your operations planned end date must now be revised, and the period of heightened monitoring 
must be extended.

Further details of the failure of your operations administrator to ensure compliance include the following:

-Operation was unable to meet compliance with Medium-High or High weighted licensing citations, including 
having an open investigation(s).

Finding: 748.535(2)  The licensed administrator must ensure the operation complies with current heightened 
monitoring plan.

An administrative penalty will be assessed as a result of this citation, in accordance with the Texas Human 
Resources Code Sec. 42.078, but the administrative penalty will be probated pending the results of any open 
investigations. If a penalty is assessed, the penalty amount will be $150 based on the total capacity of 32.
Correction Narrative: An HM extension was approved effective 3/16/2025.  In conjunction with this extension, a new deadline was established by which all requirements must be completed by your GRO in order for the operation to be released from its HM plan and move to the Post-plan Monitoring Stage of HM.  Because the extended deadline is now effective, HHSC has determined that the operation is compliant with the requirements of 26 TAC 748.535(2).  The HM deadline for your operation has been extended by 6 months and the new deadline is 9/15/2025.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff EBI SAMA training certificate was expired.
Correction Narrative: A corrective action was received from the operation's administrator on 04/01/2025 stating an EBI training was conducted on 03/30/2025 and 03/31/2025. A training certificate was received for the staff that had the expired training certificate.

Deficiency Narrative: During an investigation, several children in care indicated that staff were loud with them or had yelled at them.
Correction Narrative:
In an email received from the administrator on 02/14/25 an attachment contained the corrective action plan. The plan for findings includes the following: All staff will attend a meeting/training to review (agency) policy along with TBRI program as a reminder of proper discipline and de-escalation.
2/26 a physical follow up was conducted with HM Inspection 4044696. A shift supervisor and the administrator were interviewed regarding supervision, ratio, meds, and discipline. No concerns. Due to new staff onboarding, the training to review policy has not been completed yet, upon completion a sign in sheet of attendance will be submitted to Licensing.

Deficiency Narrative: During an investigation, several children in care indicated they had been hit on the hand by a staff for trying to change the radio or turn the volume up.  Other children in care witnesses this occurring.
Correction Narrative:
An email received on 02/14/25 from the operation's administrator identified the following corrective action plan: The alleged staff has already been met with regarding proper discipline and de-escalation. A sign has been placed in the transport van stating that no residents should touch the radio and the rules for what age can sit in the front seat. All staff will attend a meeting/training to review (agency) policy along with TBRI program as a reminder of proper discipline and de-escalation. 
2/26 a physical follow up was conducted with HM Inspection 4044696. A shift supervisor and the administrator was interviewed regarding supervision, ratio, meds, and discipline. No concerns. Due to new staff onboarding, the training to review policy has not been completed yet, upon completion a sign in sheet of attendance will be submitted to Licensing. The sign was observed by HM, and photos taken and available in the document library. 
Follow up completed on 03/11/25 obtained a copy of the sign-in sheet for staff training on Policies, Procedures, and Behavior De-escalation dated 03/07/25. There are four staff signatures on the sign-in sheet along with the administrator. Administrator stated the operation has been slowly retraining staff but due to staff shortages it has taken longer.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was discovered that a caregiver fell asleep on an evening shift.
Correction Narrative:
The staff that was alleged to be asleep is no longer employed by Girls Haven. The remaining staff all participated in 
a staff meeting regarding the 24 hours awake supervision policy and signed acknowledgments. As part of a 
compliance plan, we also have policies in place which includes administrative staff doing random check ins of both the facility and cameras.

An in-person inspection was conducted on 06/04/2024 (Inspection #4004656), where nighttime supervision was discussed. The operation stated that they were frustrated that they were not aware of the incident when it occurred, however regulatory was made aware of the incident after it happened. The operation stated that they have a roster of night-employees that they feel confident in currently.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member at the operation was not providing adequate supervision to children in care due to the staff sleeping.
Correction Narrative:
An corrective action was received from the operation's administrator on 02/27/2023 stating the following:  Girls Haven will conduct an inside investigation on the alleged staff and then take proper action with either a written warning and/or employee termination. We will also conduct a staff meeting and training to ensure all night staff are aware and willing to comply with staying awake and see if there are any suggestions on what we can offer in assistance. 
An inspection was conducted on 02/27/2024 by the assigned inspector, two staff and the administrator were interviewed. Both staff denied sleeping and the administrator provided a corrective action plan.

A follow-up email was sent from RCCR staff to the operation's administrator on 02/29/2024 requesting the date of the internal investigation and the staff training/staff meeting.
The assigned inspector stated he will be reviewing the training documentation sign-in sheet when the next inspection is conducted.

On 03/11/2024, I, Andrew Ward conducted an inspection in which training documentation from the plan of correction was reviewed. No concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: Med logs were reviewed during a heightened monitoring contracts inspection on 11/1/2023 for youth D.M. During the review of the medication log and medication, RCM observed the medication count for AM Risperidone did not correspond with medication log. According to the medication log there were 2 tablets for Risperidone remaining on the AM log; however, there was only one pill remaining.
Correction Narrative:
Compliance was established through a physical-inspection. Inspection #3977093 was conducted on 11/20/2023. Six children's medication logs were reviewed alongside an actual count of children's medications. No medication errors, miscounts, or other discrepancies were observed. 

Written Compliance was received on 11/22/2023. The employee was retrained on policies and procedures for Medication Administration.

Deficiency Narrative:
During a review conducted on September 5, 2023, it was determined that:
(1) the Administrator failed to ensure compliance with the current HM Plan; and 
(2) 12 months had elapsed since the effective date of the plan.

As a direct result of the administrators failure to ensure timely compliance with the heightened monitoring plan, this operation is now unable to successfully move to post-plan monitoring.  Furthermore, the operations planned end date must now be revised, and the period of heightened monitoring must be extended.
Further details of the administrators failure to ensure compliance include the following: 
- Operation failed to demonstrate 6 months of successive compliance with the standard and contract requirements that led to heightened monitoring.

In conjunction with this extension, a new deadline was established by which all requirements must be completed by your GRO in order for the operation to be released from its HM plan and move to the Post-plan Monitoring Stage of HM.  Because the extended deadline is now effective, HHSC has determined that the operation is compliant with the requirements of 26 TAC 748.535(2). The HM deadline for your operation has been extended by 6 months and the new deadline is March 6, 2023.

The Clinical Team will continue to review and audit the resident binders on a monthly basis.

RCCR verified the professional qualifications for the LPC in order to ensure the contractor met the professional qualifications and determined to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Room 5 had mildew on the closet ceiling.
The operation's fire inspection has expired as of 03/02/2022.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, a medication error was discovered. In the child's file reviewed, a medication error occurred in which the remaining medication count was 52. However, the medication log reflected 53.
Correction Narrative: All medication trained staff have been addressed on the importance of logging each medication given and maintaining a correct count. A medication error was written and placed in binder.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation continues to be without a qualified full time Licensed Child Care Administrator. The operation's board continues efforts in the search for an Administrator.
Correction Narrative: Elizabeth Milam passed the LCCA exam and is now active licensed LCCA. Verification in CLASS Admin Lic. C14841.

Deficiency Narrative: A child fell on the return from school on 11/19/21, injuring her arm and leg, requiring medical treatment (received same day), and follow ups. The operation did not report the serious incident until 11/21/21.
Correction Narrative:
Operation submitted on 1/6/22-Corrective Action Plan for 748.303(a)(2)(A)  Girls Haven has revisited our on-call and reporting procedures with a focus on DFPS reporting. Shift Supervisors on-duty shall be required to report all serious incidents to the on-call administrator as soon as possible and all incidents that require notifications to law enforcement and DFPS licensing shall be reported according to the required timeframes as required by minimum standards. In addition, the Executive Director shall be notified on all serious incidents; a responsibility that shall be by the primary on-call administrator. Specifically, any serious injuries shall be reported to DFFS licensing as soon as possible and by no later than 24 hours after the injury warrants treatment. All Girls Haven shift supervisors and on-call administrators have been trained on the above-mentioned plan. 
*There was a delay in receiving the corrections due to the operation sending to the incorrect email address.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of interviews with children in the operation, it was found that that one staff member made comments that were demeaning and negative towards their body and weight.
Correction Narrative:
A corrective action plan was submitted through email on 1/26/2022. The plan for findings is as follows: All staff have been addressed on Child Rights and appropriate conversation with residents. Additionally, on February 2nd and 3rd, 2022, all Shift Supervisors will be attending a TBRI training. 

Facility's Corrective Action Plan has been uploaded to digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation does not have a qualified full time Licensed Child Care Administrator.
A child in care was placed in a restraint due to staff retaliation.
Correction Narrative: 1.	Upon discovery of the video footage of in the incident, Ms. Ava was suspended from 11/19/21-11/24/21. A plan was put in place where she agreed to refrain from acting in retaliation, using improper methods to gain compliance, use proper SAMA methods, and attend a mandatory training on behavior management and crisis intervention. The suspension and disciplinary action are both attached for your review. The training will be held this Friday, January 7, 2022.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was restrained because she threw a ball that hit an employee on the leg.
Correction Narrative: 1.	Upon discovery of the video footage of in the incident, Ms. Ava was suspended from 11/19/21-11/24/21. A plan was put in place where she agreed to refrain from acting in retaliation, using improper methods to gain compliance, use proper SAMA methods, and attend a mandatory training on behavior management and crisis intervention. The suspension and disciplinary action are both attached for your review. The training will be held this Friday, January 7, 2022.

Deficiency Narrative:
During the inspection, it was found that the Development Public Relation Coordinator did not have a background check submitted or cleared prior to being allowed to be present at the operation. In order to assure timely completion of background checks, it is recommended
that the operation submit background checks prior to allowing employees to be present at the facility.
One service plan review does not document plans to address risk of runaway for a child who has a history of running away.
Correction Narrative: 7/19/21-Operation has scheduled a service plan review meeting for 7/27/21, to update the service plan to address high risk behaviors.

Deficiency Narrative: One child's initial service plan does not document history of high risk behaviors nor plans to address the high risk behavior.
Correction Narrative: 7/19/21-Operation has scheduled a service plan review meeting for 7/27/21, to update the service plan regarding history of high risk behaviors and plans to address high risk behaviors.

Deficiency Narrative: One child did not have a 6 month dental exam.
Correction Narrative: 7/19/21-Operation provided corrective plan. The child's dental appointment has been scheduled for 7/23/21.

Deficiency Narrative: One child did not have a TB screening until 3 months after placement.
Correction Narrative: Operation provided copy of the completed TB screening. Operation's plan to address is to ensure required dates are tracked and appointments scheduled in advance.

Deficiency Narrative: Two bathrooms at the facility (R-4 and A-19) have visible water damage on the ceiling tiles.
Correction Narrative: The operation submitted an updated plan regarding HM Plan Task #5 that was accepted and approved by the HM Team effective 06-21-21.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, 1 child did not receive prescribed medication as prescribed. The child was out of medication on 04-25-21 and was provided the nonprescription brand, until the prescription was filled on 04-30-21.

Dresser drawer pulls were missing on furniture in R-5, R-8, and R-10. A Dresser drawer is missing in R-15. A desk drawer is missing in R-6. Couches in the main living area were observed to have a grimy substance smeared on them and a piece of tape was covering a hole.
The light fixture over the shower unit in R-5 is not rated for a shower area. The facility has a recessed can light fixture with a regular halogen bulb and no protective cover.

HM Task #5 was found deficient. Starting on 01/22 R-15 was identified as needing a dresser drawer repaired. The repair has not been completed for the identified maintenance need as of this inspection.

There were holes observed in the walls in R-6, R-15, and in the bathroom of R-5/A-19. The walls throughout the bedrooms and hallways had various areas with smeared grimy substances. 

Flooring in all bedrooms were covered in debris. In vacant rooms, the floors were also covered in debris and there was trash shoved under furniture. 

The flooring in the bathroom for R-2/R-3 was peeling. The flooring in the bathroom for R-4/R-5 was cracked and a section had mold growing. 

The ceiling tiles in most bathrooms/bedrooms had visible dust hanging and had water damage. There is a cracked ceiling tile located over the bed in R-8. 

There were nails sticking out of trim in R-12 and the bathroom for R-2/R-3. Two nails were observed protruding from the wall about six inches from the top bunk in R-8. 

A sink in R-11 leaks water, has a rusted-out garbage disposal, and does not drain properly. 

A bathroom sink in R-4 has what appears to be dried vomit.

HM Task #6 was evaluated and found to be deficient. Four of sixteen child records reviewed were missing medication audits on 02/03/2021. Two children were missing an audit for one of their medications. One child had a prescription breathing treatment listed on her audit; however, her medication binder does not show this as a prescribed medication.
Two of three child medication logs were observed to have inaccurate medication counts.
Two of three child medication logs were missing five medication error reports. One child's medication record was observed to have seven incomplete medication error reports.
Correction Narrative:
On 12/4/2020, An additional medication management refresher training was held with all shift supervisors; training topics included:

Implementation of new medication error report 
X	
Implementation of weekly medication audit

Implementation of revised all medication logs to be used; prescription medications, non-prescription medications & as-needed medications.

Deficiency Narrative: One of three child medication logs were observed to have been completed by the same person, hand printed six different staff names, for 11 straight days.
Correction Narrative:
On 12/4/2020  During the medication administering training, the following topic included:

Implementation of revised medication error form.

All supervisors reminded that a medication error form must be completed for all errors, with no exceptions.

Implementation of Heightened Monitoring Plan in relation to medication management. (Referencing HM plan  Medication Management  Task #6)

Deficiency Narrative: A youth on a 15 min check supervision plan left the facility, returning highly intoxicated and requiring medical treatment. The observation log for the youth documents a time span of 35 mins between the last 2 checks. Another youth with a 30 min check supervision plan left the facility at the same time. The observation log for this youth documents a time span of 50 mins between the last 2 checks. Both observation logs were observed to have had the times changed and initialed by another staff.
Correction Narrative:
The facility submitted corrections for the deficiencies found within this investigation. X	

The on-duty shift supervisor was suspended without pay for 2 days on December 2nd, 2020 and upon being reinstated, the shift supervisor was issued a formal letter of reprimand on December 3rd, 2020.

The supervisor during the event demoted from shift supervisor and transferred to another shift as a youth care specialist. 

The on-duty youth care specialist was issued a formal letter of reprimand on December 3rd, 2020.
